https://www.facebook.com/portroyalcharterday

Event details:

The Annual Charter Day Festival is coming to the Town of Port Royal in the form of a Fall Pirate Festival on Oct. 3rd from 10AM to 5PM at 419 King Street, Port Royal, VA 22535.  Charter Day celebrates that Port Royal has been a recognized Town for over 270 years.  The Town of Port Royal is on the Historical Registry.  This free event with free parking and will feature colonial and civil war history as well as our maritime history - as Port Royal was a major port during colonial times.

The story of our of pirate, Pneuman, will be told by our very own Town Crier. Pirate dress is encouraged and there will be costume contests for children, youth and adults with prizes awarded in each category. The Costume Contest is scheduled for 3PM.  The festival features Captain Jaxx Parrow the Blue-Eye Pirate (hailing from Bristow, VA) and Blackbeard's Crew (hailing from Hampton, VA).  There will be mayhem in the streets of Port Royal and there will be some sword play and cannon fire!

Children will also be able to participate in old school games such as sack races, three-legged races, wheel barrow races and egg toss.  Entry into the contests is free and prizes will be awarded.  We will have a bounce house to entertain the children (height requirements will be in force).  Additional fee activities will include face painting and pony rides.

We haven't forgotten our furry friends!  New for this year's event is a pet photo contest.  Snap a picture of your pet in a pirate themed costume and submit your pictures via email to charterday.portroyal@gmail.com by Sept. 30th.  Prizes will be awarded in the categories:  dog, cat and other.  Get those entries in now - the 3 finalists in each category will be featured at the Festival.  (Need not be present to win.)  Submissions will be featured on our Facebook pages.

Also, new this year will be Antiques Appraisal - similar to the "Antique Road Show".  This service will be provided by professional antiques appraiser:  Brian Penniston of Queen Street Antiques Mall, from Tappahannock, VA.  This service will be fee based -  $5.00 per item.  Please send pictures of your items ahead of time so that we may be prepared to accurately appraise your item.  Pre-registration is encouraged and fees may be paid by PayPal in advance or day of the event. Walk-ins will be accepted but limited based on demand. 

Live music featuring the Gary Lee Tolley and Friends Band will be on stage from around 1:30 to 4:30.  The Gary Lee Tolley and Friends band plays beach music, country and oldies tunes.   Limited seating will be available.  Feel free to bring lawn chairs. 

Also entertaining us during band breaks and helping to MC the event will be Michael Burke Entertainment - providing DJ services and more contests!  A limbo contest is scheduled with prizes awarded!  How low can you go? 

The best food trucks in the area will be providing great food to our guests from 10AM to 5PM so come hungry!  Spencer Devon Micro Brewery beer will be available and served on premises.  We have expanded our food and beer gardens to allow guests to sit and relax during the event. 

Over 70 Vendors will have unique and specialty wares for sale. Featuring jewelry, home décor, beauty, health and wellness, clothing, foods, crafters, artisans! This is a perfect chance to start your holiday shopping! Many will offer hand crafted, one of a kind items.  Most vendors accept credit cards for payment.

The formal program of events will begin at 10AM.  This will be a family friendly event with lots to do and see.  We hope you will come out and celebrate our Charter Day with the Town of Port Royal. For more information contact us by phone at 804-742-1218 or follow us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/townofportroyalva

Florence Manufacturing 

The Future of Mailboxes. Delivered Today.

There are many reasons to repair or replace your mailbox system. . .maybe it has sustained some damage; maybe you are remodeling the area where it is located; or maybe the next generation mailboxes have security that is far superior to what you are currently using. Regardless of your reason, it is important to understand when it is acceptable to simply replace the existing mailbox with the same type of box, and when you are required to upgrade your mailbox system altogether.

Outside of our wide range of products, our experienced engineers can also design a customized installation specific to your needs. In the past, they've lent their talents to create unique, specialized product installations for corporations from the Las Vegas Strip to New York’s Wall Street to government agencies in Saudi Arabia and everything in between.

http://www.federalbuyersguideinc.com/press-release/10914

(From right to left) Essex County Board of Supervisors Chairman Edwin "Bud" Smith presents a resolution to Fort A.P. Hill Garrison Commander Lt. Col. Jack Haefner in honor of his service at Fort A.P. Hill. Haefner assumed command at Fort A.P. Hill June 19, 2009 and will relinquish command to incoming commander Lt. Col. Peter E. Dargle at a Change of Command Ceremony June 18, 2012. The resolution states Haefner, "has brought attention to Fort A.P. Hill reminding us of its enduring value and awesome contributions to all of us, be especially to surrounding communities."
Many thanks to our wonderful Essex County friends and neighbors!
